DataElement.preferredName: Transplant Conditioning Target Timepoint Begin Administered Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the target timepoint for the start of transplant conditioning.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Transplant Conditioning Target Timepoint Begin Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection)._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy,
to a transplant.

Concepts.definition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than 12 Week Up to 6 Month
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::12: Any period of seven consecutive days.: Used to indicate a limit or boundary.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::6: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
